revised_title: A Case Study of a Numerically Gifted Illiterate Youth
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Education
tldr: A 17-year-old illiterate youth can perform complex mathematical calculations in his head, such as fractions and multiplication. He learned this skill through working with money from selling sea snails and muscles. His ability to perform calculations is so impressive that the author considers teaching him to read, write, and do basic math. This case study highlights the potential for learning and cognitive abilities beyond traditional education.
